ObjTextEntries.textEntry:
Signature:  The painting is signed "R.M." in the upper left corner.

GSA Buildings Manager measured this work on January 5, 1993; exact dimensions are 13' x 15'8".  Abstract black and white mural .  Walter Gropius, chief design architect with The Architects Collaborative and Samuel Glaser Associates, assisted GSA in selecting abstract expressionist Robert Motherwell, known for his admiration of The President, for this commission. The Commission of Fine Arts approved the selection in February 1966 and the artist installed the mural in August 1966.

Oil on canvas

Auxiliary Support:  The original stretcher is an expansion bolt stretcher with seven cross members: three horizontal wooden cross members and four vertical aluminum cross members.

Support:  The original canvas is a coarse plain weave canvas.
